dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1145612937 at Thu Apr  1 07:46:01 UTC 2021

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: websockets Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="websockets"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="websockets"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="websockets"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="websockets"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="websockets"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="websockets"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="websockets"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="websockets"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: websockets Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

panels.content:
### Description

Measures aggregated HTTP request traffic through the HAProxy.
5xx responses are considered to be failures.

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors Rails endpoints, running in the Git fleet, via the HTTP interface.



### Observability Tools

* [Sentry Releases: gitlab/gitlabcom](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/releases/)
* [üìñ Kibana: Rails logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.status,json.controller,json.action,json.path,json.duration_s),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase))))),index:'AW5F1e45qthdGjPJueGO',query:(language:kuery,query:''))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

* [üìà Kibana: Rails requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1e45qthdGjPJueGO&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Rails failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1e45qthdGjPJueGO&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(range:(json.status:(gte:500))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

* [üìà Kibana: Rails sum latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1e45qthdGjPJueGO&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_s),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.controller.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.duration_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Rails percentile latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1e45qthdGjPJueGO&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_s,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.duration_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: workhorse SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors the Workhorse instance running in the Websockets fleet, via the HTTP interface.
This only covers the initial protocal upgrade requests to `/-/cable`.
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/296845 tracks making these metrics more useful for Websockets.



### Observability Tools

* [Google Stackdriver Continuous Profiling](https://console.cloud.google.com/profiler;timespan=4h/workhorse-websockets;type=CPU/cpu?project=gitlab-production)
* [Sentry Releases: gitlab/gitlab-workhorse-gitlabcom](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlab-workhorse-gitlabcom/releases/)
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4',query:(language:kuery,query:''))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(range:(json.duration_ms:(gte:10000))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4',query:(language:kuery,query:''))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(range:(json.status:(gte:500))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4',query:(language:kuery,query:''))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:websockets,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Network utilization
panels.title: websockets Deployment: Network IO

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="disk_inodes"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Rails uses connection pools for its database connections. As each
node may have multiple connection pools, this is by node and by
database host.

Read more about this resource in our [documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/database/client_side_connection_pool.html#client-side-connection-pool).

If this resource is saturated, it may indicate that our connection
pools are not correctly sized, perhaps because an unexpected
application thread is using a database connection.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, instance, host, port) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(gitlab_database_connection_pool_busy{class="ActiveRecord::Base", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[5m])
        +
        avg_over_time(gitlab_database_connection_pool_dead{class="ActiveRecord::Base", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[5m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_database_connection_pool_size{class="ActiveRecord::Base", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: rails_db_connection_pool component saturation: Rails DB Connection Pool Utilization

panels.description:
Ruby (technically Ruby MRI), like some other scripting languages, uses a Global VM lock (GVL) also known as a
Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) to ensure that multiple threads can execute safely. Ruby code is only allowed to
execute in one thread in a process at a time. When calling out to c extensions, the thread can cede the lock to
other thread while it continues to execute.

This means that when CPU-bound workloads run in a multithreaded environment such as Puma or Sidekiq, contention
with other Ruby worker threads running in the same process can occur, effectively slowing thoses threads down as
they await GVL entry.

Often the best fix for this situation is to add more workers by scaling up the fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, pod) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(ruby_process_cpu_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[10m])
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: ruby_thread_contention component saturation: Ruby Thread Contention

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Puma thread utilization per node.

Puma uses a fixed size thread pool to handle HTTP requests. This metric shows how many threads are busy handling requests. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (avg_over_time(instance:puma_active_connections:sum{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"}[1m]))
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (instance:puma_max_threads:sum{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="websockets"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_puma_workers component saturation: Puma Worker Saturation per Node

This graph shows the average number of secondary database connections

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="websockets", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or

absent(fake_dne{component="redis_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_memory", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_primary_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_primary_cpu", severity="s1"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_secondary_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_secondary_cpu", severity="s4"})
or

)

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="websockets", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="websockets", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="websockets", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="websockets", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="websockets",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph db
  patroni
  pgbouncer
  redis
  redis-cache
  redis-sidekiq
end

subgraph stor
  gitaly
  praefect
end

subgraph sv
  websockets
end


  gitaly --> gitaly
pgbouncer --> patroni
praefect --> gitaly
websockets --> gitaly
websockets --> patroni
websockets --> pgbouncer
websockets --> praefect
websockets --> redis
websockets --> redis-cache
websockets --> redis-sidekiq
